meanings.definition: A mistake or error in judgment or action.
meanings.sent1: Her misstep in the presentation cost her the opportunity.
meanings.sent2: Making a misstep in the experiment led to unexpected results.
meanings.sent3: His misstep in the game was so silly that everyone burst out laughing.
meanings.sent4: The misstep in their plan caused everything to fall apart.
meanings.sent5: The misstep in his speech was unforgettable and embarrassing.

meanings.definition: To take a wrong step or make a mistake while walking or dancing.
meanings.sent1: She misstepped on the uneven pavement and almost fell.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to misstep on the slippery floor.
meanings.sent3: He misstepped during the dance but quickly recovered with a smile.
meanings.sent4: Misstepping in the routine threw off the entire performance.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's misstep was graceful, as if part of the choreography.
